intro: Collomia grandiflora f. scabra, commonly known as the scabrous collomia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and sagebrush steppe. Its distinctive scabrous texture and vibrant floral display make it a notable species in its native range.
